intro: Ochrothallus litseiflorus, commonly known as the litsea-flowered ochrothallus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical ecosystems.
